title: The One Where Everyone Was High: People Were Served Hash Cake At A Funeral By Mistake
text:
The One Where Everyone Was High: People Were Served Hash Cake At A Funeral By Mistake

The One Where Everyone Was High: People Were Served Hash Cake At A Funeral By Mistake

Apparently, it is a tradition in Germany to have coffee and cake after attending a funeral. However, a lot of people who attended a particular funeral ended up in a hospital afterwards, because they mistakenly ate a hashish cake.

People at a funeral in northeastern Germany were served a cake laced with hashish, according to the police in the city of Rostock.

The mourners gathered at a restaurant to have coffee and cake as per their tradition, but after having the cake, reportedly 13 people - including the widow - started feeling nauseous and dizzy. One of the women had to be rushed to the hospital via ambulance and others sought treatment later in the day.

Shutterstock

The mourners then reportedly pressed charges.

Authorities found out that the drug-laced cake was brought to the restaurant by an employee in charge of baked goods, who had asked her 18-year-old daughter to bake cakes for the funeral.

The daughter did bake the required cakes, but she also separately baked a hash cake for herself to be consumed at some occasion. The mother reportedly took the hash cake with her, instead of the normal cake.

The 18-year-old girl now faces 13 charges of negligence including causing bodily injury, disturbing a funeral and violating Germany's narcotics law.

Well, now these people know what being high on a funeral feels like. Let's face it, that's not a sentence you read every day.
